condition.description:
Restless legs syndrome (RLS) causes a powerful urge to move your legs. Your legs become uncomfortable when you are lying down or sitting. Some people describe it as a creeping, crawling, tingling, or burning sensation. Moving makes your legs feel better, but not for long. RLS can make it hard to fall asleep and stay asleep.

In most cases, there is no known cause for RLS. In other cases, RLS is caused by a disease or condition, such as anemia or pregnancy. Some medicines can also cause temporary RLS. Caffeine, tobacco, and alcohol may make symptoms worse.

Lifestyle changes, such as regular sleep habits, relaxation techniques, and moderate exercise during the day can help. If those don't work, medicines may reduce the symptoms of RLS.

Most people with RLS also have a condition called periodic limb movement disorder (PLMD). PLMD is a condition in which a person's legs twitch or jerk uncontrollably, usually during sleep. PLMD and RLS can also affect the arms.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
condition.name: Restless legs syndrome

carousel_items: Don't stop taking Horizant suddenly without telling your doctor.
Can make you feel dizzy or drowsy the first few days or weeks that you're taking it.
Swallow the pills whole and take with food.
Horizant is different from other forms of gabapentin (like Neurontin), so these two medications can't be switched or substituted for each other.

basics.benefits_moa: Horizant treats restless leg syndrome and pain caused by shingles by lowering your body's response to pain. It's used for long-lasting (chronic) pain and doesn't work for sudden (acute) pain.
basics.bottom_line: Horizant is a good way to treat pain since it can be used with other pain medications and it's not addictive. You'll need to stop drinking alcohol and it can be somewhat expensive.
downsides: Need to avoid alcohol while on Horizant.
Has to be taken with food.
If you want to stop taking this medication, you need to talk to your doctor first since stopping it cold turkey can cause seizures.
Not available as a generic.

downsides_processed.orig: Need to avoid alcohol while on Horizant.
Has to be taken with food.
If you want to stop taking this medication, you need to talk to your doctor first since stopping it cold turkey can cause seizures.
Not available as a generic.

upsides: Not habit-forming or addictive.
Can be used with other pain medications.
Only has to be taken once or twice a day.

upsides_processed.orig: Not habit-forming or addictive.
Can be used with other pain medications.
Only has to be taken once or twice a day.

drugs.one_liner: Calms leg movements and nerve pain.

userStories.tip: Also taking alpha lipoic acid and acetyl-l-carnitine, changed exercise from walking to swimming, no alcohol...not sure which things are most helpful, but suspect that a combination of the above reduced the nerve pain.  I am on 300 mg/day

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Horizant suddenly without telling your doctor.
Can make you feel dizzy or drowsy the first few days or weeks that you're taking it.
Swallow the pills whole and take with food.
Horizant is different from other forms of gabapentin (like Neurontin), so these two medications can't be switched or substituted for each other.

risks_warnings.title: Effects on driving
risks_warnings.description: Horizant can affect your ability to drive. Until you know how Horizant works in your body, you shouldn't drive since your reaction time can be slowed down.

description_processed.orig: Horizant can affect your ability to drive. Until you know how Horizant works in your body, you shouldn't drive since your reaction time can be slowed down.

risks_warnings.title: Dizziness | Sleepiness
risks_warnings.description: Horizant can make you feel dizzy or sleepy for the first few days or weeks that you take it. Until your body has adjusted to the medication, be very careful getting up from sitting or lying down, and don't drive or use machinery.

description_processed.orig: Horizant can make you feel dizzy or sleepy for the first few days or weeks that you take it. Until your body has adjusted to the medication, be very careful getting up from sitting or lying down, and don't drive or use machinery.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mood
risks_warnings.description: People on Horizant have reported changes in their mood, including anxiety and depression. This is rare. Call your doctor immediately if your mood darkens, or if you think about hurting yourself or other people.

description_processed.orig: People on Horizant have reported changes in their mood, including anxiety and depression. This is rare. Call your doctor immediately if your mood darkens, or if you think about hurting yourself or other people.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people taking Horizant who get a severe skin rash that can require hospitalization. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with a fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people taking Horizant who get a severe skin rash that can require hospitalization. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with a fever.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor if you want to stop taking Horizant. There have been reports of people having seizures after stopping to take the medication suddenly. Your doctor will work with you to stop taking this medication safely.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor if you want to stop taking Horizant. There have been reports of people having seizures after stopping to take the medication suddenly. Your doctor will work with you to stop taking this medication safely.

carousel_items: Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD. It works in the brain and lowers the activity of certain stress hormones, but it's not a stimulant like many ADHD medicines.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a non-stimulant option to manage ADHD symptoms and behaviors, but it can lower your blood pressure.
downsides: Can lower blood pressure.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Can lower blood pressure.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

upsides_processed.orig: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

drugs.one_liner: Treats ADHD and lowers blood pressure.
drugs.name: Kapvay

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal (rebound hypertension)
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low heart rate (bradycardia)
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.
risk_factors: Using other medicine(s) that slows the heart

description_processed.orig: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure (hypotension)
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure in the first week of taking Clonidine. Let your doctor know if you continue to feel dizzy after 1 week of use.

description_processed.orig: Clonidine can lower your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure in the first week of taking Clonidine. Let your doctor know if you continue to feel dizzy after 1 week of use.

carousel_items: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, and salivation.
Report any confusion or inability to control muscle movements to your doctor.
Not safe to use with alcohol.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonazepam is a fast-acting benzodiazepine. It affects neurotransmitters in the brain and calms the nervous system. This reduces anxiety and muscle spasms, and causes sleepiness.
basics.bottom_line: Clonazepam is okay for occasional or short-term use (up to 4 weeks) for anxiety, and to treat seizures. Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to similar drugs.
downsides: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

upsides: Effective at relieving short-term anxiety and sleeplessness.
Can be used together with antidepressants to manage anxiety disorders. Especially helpful for anxiety symptoms while you wait for an antidepressant to kick in (it can take several weeks).
Can be used alone or with other medicines to treat seizures.
Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to other benzodiazepines.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at relieving short-term anxiety and sleeplessness.
Can be used together with antidepressants to manage anxiety disorders. Especially helpful for anxiety symptoms while you wait for an antidepressant to kick in (it can take several weeks).
Can be used alone or with other medicines to treat seizures.
Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to other benzodiazepines.

drugs.one_liner: Controls seizures and helps you relax.

userStories.tip: It made me very sleepy and relaxed when I first took it but it relieved anxious feelings on the spot. Works way better than Xanax for me.. Plus it lasts longer

userStories.identifier: School student with panic and bipolar
userStories.tip: Klonopin has effectively eliminated panic from my life. I still have obsessive thoughts, but I'm aware of them and can file them to the back of my mind. Using it for more than a few weeks though has caused me to experience withdrawal.

userStories.identifier: I have approx 8 diff kinds of arthritisr
userStories.tip: heat & weight help a little such as 7-8 blankets

Tbh, I used Klonopin for benzo withdrawal. I was hooked on Xanax for about a year taking up to 6mg daily. So I went to my pshyc doctor and shared my problem. She Rx'd me Klonopin to taper off. Now I'm 100% benzo free!
First week may cause tiredness and/or fatigue. After 5-7 days if consecutive use (2-3 times a day) this will subside substantially.

Klonopin caused extreme anxiety, panic attacks, violence, increased suicide attempts to escape adverse reactions, alcohol use, caused agoraphobia. Withdrawals almost killed me. Very dangerous drug. Highly addicting.

Very good medication. Xanax makes me feel 'druggy'... Valium is also good, but seems a little less potent than Klonopin. Klonopin imo, is right in between Xanax and Valium. Klonopin is the best benzodiazepine.
Don't drink.

I take three one mg a day, I was plagued with anxiety from age 10, I was a mess and took tranzine for years, then xanax which I took way to much, had high tolerance fast, was hell coming off, started 3 1mg , hard coming off but I'm a lifer

Klonopin is a medication that one uses on a regular basis to keep anxiety or manic phases at bay.  It can take up to an hour to feel its effects and when first starting, it takes a few days to really become effective.

userStories.identifier: Social Anxiety w/SS on Autism spectrum

userStories.identifier: Field Technican, 52 years old with GAD
userStories.tip: Take as needed to avoid tolerance.
Took v low dose.  Saw no side effects and it helped quiet the teeth grinding and tightness in my stomach
Once you're on it at a daily dose, for more than 2 months, going off will be very very difficult. Google "Clonazepam" withdrawl.

I used it to get back to sleep when I woke u at 4 am, which was regularly. I also used it for high intensity moments which triggered anxiety. Careful not to go over 1.5 mg a day; it is a bit insidious in how the dosage creeps up.
Not for sudden anxiety attacks, but can help keep a baseline to prevent both my panic attacks and control mania with bipolar disorder.
userStories.identifier: Dx w/ Bipolar Type 1 and ADHD.

userStories.tip: If taking 2 or 3 times daily, make sure to take them at the timed intervals (every 6 hours, every 12 hours, etc.). Missing these time frames by more than two hours can really effect you and you don't physically feel it 'wear off'.

Actually began taking this for KNOTS in tummy and IBS. Worked off the bat. Been on it for 20 years and keeps me able to work and socialize. DON"T run out or quit, the withdrawals are horrible, worse than most Pain Pills, I know, been there.
Works great for staying asleep, but its impossible to stop taking it once you're hooked.  Very addictive
It takes a bit to kick in, so it works best as a now-and-then pill for when you're going to be in a situation you know makes you anxious.
Take it in the evening before you go to sleep, it keeps you even throughout the next day. Make sure to not take it too late, otherwise drowsiness can occur in the AM

Warning! Although Klonopin and other benzos work well to relax you, they cause PHYSICAL dependence. I was on a low dose (1 mg) and it took me a year to get off of it. A BMJ article (9/2014) says that benzo use causes dementia. Stay away!
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.identifier: Laid back with type A moments
userStories.tip: It works great for me although it is definitely addictive.  Many sources report that you need to take higher dosages for the same effect over time, but that has not been the case with me.  I love what this medication does for me.

It worked for a few months and then turned on me. Caused more symptoms and the ones it was meant to prevent came back worse than ever.  It took over two years to taper even though the doc said I could quit in a few weeks.  Off five months and still not healed yet.  Look up benzo withdrawal syndrome on Wiki.  If I helped one person I feel good.  This is POISON!
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: If you are taking it long-term, try to take as low a dose as possible. Withdrawl after long-term use is extremely unpleasant.
userStories.identifier: Parent, works in software, wife/2 kids

userStories.tip: Obviously, a fast acting benzo is going to be "overall worth it". It stops the panic. It stops the bodily sensations of oncoming panic attacks. It makes life bearable after being traumatized.
Dosage and timing is everything with Clonazepam.  Start off at 1 mg and evaluate from there. Also take at least and 90 minutes before you need it to start working.
userStories.identifier: Easy going and a team player.

drugs.name: Klonopin

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, and salivation.
Report any confusion or inability to control muscle movements to your doctor.
Not safe to use with alcohol.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Clonazepam for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Clonazepam should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: If you use Clonazepam for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Clonazepam should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonazepam suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose when stopping or switching to a different medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonazepam suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose when stopping or switching to a different medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Clonazepam can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Clonazepam while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Clonazepam can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Clonazepam while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonazepam impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Clonazepam. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Clonazepam impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Clonazepam. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Memory problems
risks_warnings.description: Your brain may have difficulty making new memories while you're taking Clonazepam.

description_processed.orig: Your brain may have difficulty making new memories while you're taking Clonazepam.

carousel_items: Side effects are common, but usually manageable.
Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.
Stop taking Gabapentin slowly over at least one week to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

clock.tip: Works faster and stronger when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Gabapentin is an antiepileptic and nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Gabapentin is an old seizure disorder medicine that's now used to treat nerve-related pain caused by different conditions.
downsides: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

downsides_processed.orig: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

upsides: Originally used to treat epilepsy (partial seizures), but now it primarily treats neuropathic pain that's caused by nerve stimulation or damage.
Studies show it's most effective for nerve pain from diabetes, shingles, and fibromyalgia (a painful muscle condition).
It's available as a generic, so it's less expensive than similar medications.

upsides_processed.orig: Originally used to treat epilepsy (partial seizures), but now it primarily treats neuropathic pain that's caused by nerve stimulation or damage.
Studies show it's most effective for nerve pain from diabetes, shingles, and fibromyalgia (a painful muscle condition).
It's available as a generic, so it's less expensive than similar medications.

does anyone have diarrhea from this drug? I take 2100mg a day, works well for nerve pain.
works well for nerve pain

I took Gabapentin for 2 years and decided to stop taking it. Within 2 weeks the pain in my legs became severe. I started taking it again and . . . no pain!

Never had any side effects,,,,,,, been taking it for over 2 yrs or more. I feel i'm taking it only because the dr. said to.... I don't find that it helps for my fibromyalgia/arthritis. I still have to take a narcotic,,,,,so i don't really see why I should be on it. I know my memory is the pits,,,,still have anxiety too. I'm on 900 mgs,,,300 x3 a day.. I'd like to quit it, but am afraid to...so i'm stuck with them for who knows how long.......I am going  to bring  up this matter with my doc next visit. I hear there are replacements to gabapentin.....

you gain a lot of weight/ 300mg/ 3 times a day. i've been tiny at 90 pds. through my 20's and 30's.then i was 105 in my 40's.i'm 48 years old. gain 85 extra pds. i eat fruits,vegies.juice,water,meat-fish,salads,greek y.i do exerices,tred.

Taking this drug in the evening gave me a solid night's sleep.  I started calling it my coma pill.  Before taking it, I hadn't sleep more than 2 hours without waking up and couldn't get back to sleep.  Now, I get 7-8 hours without waking.

drugs.name: Neurontin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Side effects are common, but usually manageable.
Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.
Stop taking Gabapentin slowly over at least one week to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Neurologic and psychiatric side effects (children)
risks_warnings.description: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

description_processed.orig: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

risks_warnings.title: Serious rash and multiple organ problems
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

carousel_items: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Report skin rashes or blistering immediately.
Don't use if pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes up to 5 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

basics.benefits_moa: Tegretol is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to block certain kinds of nerve activity to reduce seizures and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Tegretol is useful for preventing seizures and relieving certain types of nerve pain, but interacts with many drugs.
downsides: Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Higher risk of skin reactions compared to other antiepileptic medicines, ranging from mild to life-threatening rash.
Can cause blurry vision, dizziness, and upset stomach.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

downsides_processed.orig: Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Higher risk of skin reactions compared to other antiepileptic medicines, ranging from mild to life-threatening rash.
Can cause blurry vision, dizziness, and upset stomach.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic and partial seizures.
First-line option for trigeminal neuralgia (nerve pain involving the face, head, and neck), and can relieve other types of nerve pain.
May be helpful in stabilizing mood for people with bipolar disorder.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic and partial seizures.
First-line option for trigeminal neuralgia (nerve pain involving the face, head, and neck), and can relieve other types of nerve pain.
May be helpful in stabilizing mood for people with bipolar disorder.

drugs.one_liner: Prevents seizures, stabilizes mood, and relieves nerve pain.

userStories.tip: How dependent I am on it. The pain is terrifying .

If the medicine is causing a rash, there are many topical steroids that will keep it under control- or vanquish it completely. I get the rash on my face- so when my doc prescribed fluocinolone, it oil changed my life.
make it part of your beauty routine etc so that you won't forget to take it. Always make sure you have enough and if on holiday, be sure to take a prescription along

drugs.name: Tegretol

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Report skin rashes or blistering immediately.
Don't use if pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes up to 5 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin rash
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. If you are of Asian descent, you may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. If you are of Asian descent, you may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause an increased risk for blood disorders. Your blood may be tested on a regular basis to see if it has low white blood cells (for fighting infections) or platelets (for blood clotting).

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause an increased risk for blood disorders. Your blood may be tested on a regular basis to see if it has low white blood cells (for fighting infections) or platelets (for blood clotting).

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to low sodium
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may cause low sodium in the body (hyponatremia), especially in people who are older. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, headache, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, weakness, or falls.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may cause low sodium in the body (hyponatremia), especially in people who are older. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, headache, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, weakness, or falls.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Tegretol suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Tegretol, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Tegretol suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Tegretol, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

carousel_items: You should start Pramipexole at a low dose and your doctor will raise the dose slowly. This will help lower your risk of side effects, such as drowsiness and low blood pressure.
Can cause intense urges and compulsive behaviors that are hard to control, such as binge eating, gambling, and sexual urges. Talk to your doctor right away if you have any of these feelings.

You can suddenly fall asleep without warning while on this medicine. Don't perform any tasks that require mental alertness, like driving, or drinking alcohol until you know how Pramipexole affects you. Let your doctor know if you have a history of sleep problems.
Take Pramipexole 2 to 3 hours before bedtime for restless leg syndrome.
Take Pramipexole with food if it makes you feel nauseous.

basics.benefits_moa: Pramipexole is a dopamine agonist. It binds to receptors in the brain and helps improve movement in people with Parkinson's disease or restless leg syndrome.
basics.bottom_line: Pramipexole is an effective medicine for Parkinson's disease or restless leg syndrome, but there are potentially serious side effects.
downsides: Pramipexole isn't a first-choice treatment for Parkinson's disease. It can be used by itself, but it's usually used with other medicines.
Pramipexole can cause hallucinations in older people.
Not the best choice if you have kidney problems. Your doctor may have to adjust your dose based on your kidney function.
You can't suddenly stop taking Pramipexole. You'll have to slowly lower your dose, especially if you've been using it for a long time.

downsides_processed.orig: Pramipexole isn't a first-choice treatment for Parkinson's disease. It can be used by itself, but it's usually used with other medicines.
Pramipexole can cause hallucinations in older people.
Not the best choice if you have kidney problems. Your doctor may have to adjust your dose based on your kidney function.
You can't suddenly stop taking Pramipexole. You'll have to slowly lower your dose, especially if you've been using it for a long time.

upsides: In studies, Pramipexole when taken by itself or with other medicines, was effective in lowering movement fluctuations for people with Parkinson's disease.
Pramipexole is sometimes preferred over other medicines that treat Parkinson's disease in older people since it causes fewer movement and mental fluctuations.
Is effective for treating restless leg syndrome.
Available in a short-acting and a long-acting form.

upsides_processed.orig: In studies, Pramipexole when taken by itself or with other medicines, was effective in lowering movement fluctuations for people with Parkinson's disease.
Pramipexole is sometimes preferred over other medicines that treat Parkinson's disease in older people since it causes fewer movement and mental fluctuations.
Is effective for treating restless leg syndrome.
Available in a short-acting and a long-acting form.

drugs.name: Mirapex

carousel_items_processed.orig: You should start Pramipexole at a low dose and your doctor will raise the dose slowly. This will help lower your risk of side effects, such as drowsiness and low blood pressure.
Can cause intense urges and compulsive behaviors that are hard to control, such as binge eating, gambling, and sexual urges. Talk to your doctor right away if you have any of these feelings.

You can suddenly fall asleep without warning while on this medicine. Don't perform any tasks that require mental alertness, like driving, or drinking alcohol until you know how Pramipexole affects you. Let your doctor know if you have a history of sleep problems.
Take Pramipexole 2 to 3 hours before bedtime for restless leg syndrome.
Take Pramipexole with food if it makes you feel nauseous.

risks_warnings.title: Impulse control problems
risks_warnings.description: Pramipexole can cause intense urges and compulsive behaviors that are hard to control, such as binge eating, gambling, and sexual urges. Talk  to your doctor right away if you have any of these feelings.

description_processed.orig: Pramipexole can cause intense urges and compulsive behaviors that are hard to control, such as binge eating, gambling, and sexual urges. Talk  to your doctor right away if you have any of these feelings.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Pramipexole lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Pramipexole lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness can occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. It's an early side effect of Pramipexole. Typically, the dizziness will go away over time as your body gets used to the medication. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change positions slowly.

description_processed.orig: Dizziness can occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. It's an early side effect of Pramipexole. Typically, the dizziness will go away over time as your body gets used to the medication. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change positions slowly.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Pramipexole is processed by the kidney. If you have kidney problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose.

description_processed.orig: Pramipexole is processed by the kidney. If you have kidney problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose.

risks_warnings.title: Skin cancer
risks_warnings.description: People with Parkinson's disease are at increased risk for melanoma (skin cancer). You may need regular skin examinations while on Pramipexole. Talk to your doctor if you notice anything unusual on your skin.

description_processed.orig: People with Parkinson's disease are at increased risk for melanoma (skin cancer). You may need regular skin examinations while on Pramipexole. Talk to your doctor if you notice anything unusual on your skin.

risks_warnings.title: Hallucinations
risks_warnings.description: Pramipexole can cause hallucinations, especially in older people.

description_processed.orig: Pramipexole can cause hallucinations, especially in older people.

carousel_items: You should start Ropinirole at a low dose and your doctor will raise the dose slowly. This will help lower your risk of side effects, such as drowsiness and low blood pressure.
Can cause intense urges and compulsive behaviors that are hard to control, such as binge eating, gambling, and sexual urges. Talk to your doctor right away if you have any of these feelings.

You can suddenly fall asleep without warning while on this medicine. Don't perform any tasks that require mental alertness, like driving, or drinking alcohol until you know how Ropinirole affects you. Let your doctor know if you have a history of sleep problems.
Take Ropinirole 2 to 3 hours before bedtime for restless leg syndrome.
Take Ropinirole with food if it makes you feel nauseous.

basics.benefits_moa: Ropinirole is a dopamine agonist. It binds to receptors in the brain and helps improve movement in people with Parkinson's disease or restless leg syndrome.
basics.bottom_line: Ropinirole is an effective medicine for Parkinson's disease or restless leg syndrome, but there are potentially serious side effects.
downsides: Ropinirole isn't a first-choice treatment for Parkinson's disease. It can be used by itself, but it's usually used with other medicines.
Ropinirole can cause hallucinations in older people.
Not the best choice if you have kidney problems. Your doctor may have to adjust your dose based on your kidney function.
You can't suddenly stop taking Ropinirole. You'll have to slowly lower your dose, especially if you've been using it for a long time.

upsides: In studies, Ropinirole when taken by itself or with other medicines, was effective in lowering movement fluctuations for people with Parkinson's disease.
Ropinirole is sometimes preferred over other medicines that treat Parkinson's disease in older people since it causes fewer movement and mental fluctuations.

Available in a short-acting and a long-acting form.

risks_warnings.title: Impulse control problems
risks_warnings.description: Ropinirole can cause intense urges and compulsive behaviors that are hard to control, such as binge eating, gambling, and sexual urges. Talk  to your doctor right away if you have any of these feelings.

description_processed.orig: Ropinirole can cause intense urges and compulsive behaviors that are hard to control, such as binge eating, gambling, and sexual urges. Talk  to your doctor right away if you have any of these feelings.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Ropinirole lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Ropinirole lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness can occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. It's an early side effect of Ropinirole. Typically, the dizziness will go away over time as your body gets used to the medication. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change positions slowly.

description_processed.orig: Dizziness can occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. It's an early side effect of Ropinirole. Typically, the dizziness will go away over time as your body gets used to the medication. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change positions slowly.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Ropinirole is processed by the kidney. If you have kidney problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose.

description_processed.orig: Ropinirole is processed by the kidney. If you have kidney problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose.

risks_warnings.title: Skin cancer
risks_warnings.description: People with Parkinson's disease are at increased risk for melanoma (skin cancer). You may need regular skin examinations while on Ropinirole. Talk to your doctor if you notice anything unusual on your skin.

description_processed.orig: People with Parkinson's disease are at increased risk for melanoma (skin cancer). You may need regular skin examinations while on Ropinirole. Talk to your doctor if you notice anything unusual on your skin.

risks_warnings.title: Hallucinations
risks_warnings.description: Ropinirole can cause hallucinations, especially in older people.

description_processed.orig: Ropinirole can cause hallucinations, especially in older people.
